comment: I am CAD Certified and was horrified by some of the part documents he gave that simply were impossible to work with. He is entirely ignorant of how to teach a class like this and essentially just has us watch him do the work and expects us to "monkey see monkey do" and expects us to know things he doesn't teach. Absolutely do not take at any point.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: If he comes out of retirement for a 5th time (no joke) avoid him at all costs. I would rather lose My EDG minor than take another class with this professor. If you have to take him, get ready to go back to kindergarten bc we literally had to TURN IN hand written notes. We had a homework asssignment for every class (over 30).Good luck
STAY AWAY FROM THIS MAN,YOU PRETTY MUCH HAVE TO TEACH YOURSELF EVERYTHING. TAKES A WHOLE BUNCH OF POINTS FOR THE SMALLEST THINGS!!!!!

Pickiest Professor I have ever had. This will be your hardest class that you spend the most time on if you dare choose it. In our groupme, we all routinely banded together in attempt to pass and this was in vein. He simply does not answer questions. We went down from a full class of 30ish to 4-5 by the dropout day. Beware Professor Winsor....
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Definitely the hardest EDG teacher. Very knowledgeable/detailed in feedback. No prior knowledge to 3D software will cause you to struggle because he expects close to perfection. Tries to keep the class lively but tests after every project and super strict grading invite a huge amount of stress. Will pass you if you put forth real effort. Genuine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Gives good feedback--Tough grader

comment: Winsor doesn't actually lecture on the course material. His sense of humor is like Ned Flanders. Avoid if at all possible.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Winsor is the worst professor I have encountered at KSU. He routinely spent 10 to 15 minutes going over the assignment instructions that had been posted for weeks. Then ramble for the remainder of class. When he was asked if he was going to lecture on the material to be tested he had a 15 minute pity party. 4 of the 12 students passed the final.
Very tough grader, don't take it if you don't know CAD. Expects you to know how to use CAD and gives tough assignments. Also, 25% off for every little mistake done. Do not recommend taking this class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: If you don't plan on using CAD in the future don't take him. He is a very tough grader but it helps you improve in SolidWorks. If you struggle his office hours are useful. MAKE SURE YOU READ HIS INSTRUCTIONS VERY CAREFULLY. If you follow the instructions you will be fine, but he does take off a lot for little things that are in the instructions.

25% off any mistakes, some mistakes are automatic zeros. He expects perfection from beginners. He will NOT work with you and will NOT make special exceptions. He wont take questions seriously, he answers with sarcasm and refers you to his old videos and Chapter 11. If your stuck with him, try his office hours. Btw, skill in CAD wont save you

He is very funny and class is fun, but when it comes to grading I've never met a harsher grader. He expects too much from beginner students and doesn't accept anything but perfection. Would not recommend this professor if you are new to his programs and don't have previous experience.

Brad is a real gem. He knows what he's doing and can move quickly if you are intent about learning the material. Be ready to do your fair share of learning at home. He gives plenty of time to finish assignments but you shouldn't start late. Its easy to fall behind. His grading is subject to you following ALL HIS WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS. Read his stuff

Professor Winsor is funny. This is fine but gets frustrating when you really want to cover the material. Classes were spent hearing jokes and reviewing the weekly calendar. You have to learn everything on your own. Grades until end of term. Laugh at his jokes, dont complain about his delays, turn everything on time and hell give you an A.

He was a very entertaining but frustrating professor for ADV graphic design. Joked about failing everyone first day of class- ended up not being a joke. VERY particular about grading. Expects you to teach yourself ALL the skills required for the tests and CSWP exam out of class. Lectures only cover what he expects you to complete on your own.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: If you want to teach solid works to yourself then this is the class for you. He knows what he is talking about but awful teacher.

DO NOT TAKE THIS GUY. He gives a lot of assignments, in the syllabus assignment is 66% of the grade but he doesnt grade them. There is a test on the day the assignment is due so you cant even review the assignment. says A and grades B. Doesnt teach in class and then gives you work like you're 3 courses ahead but he doesnt even teach the basics
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Be prepared to teach yourself everything in this class because he doesn't teach during class time. Gives lots of projects which take a lot of time but he gives very limited time to complete them. He is a funny and entertaining guy but I would not recommend him as a teacher.

Very particular and not forgiving if you submit something in the wrong format, just gives 0s. Barely teaches anything, spent half the time of each class going over the calendar. Also makes sexist and drug related jokes; big boomer humor energy. Will only grade tests, you will never see an assignment grade. Pretty easy if you jump through his hoops.

Mr. Winsor is an excellent professor. He challenges his students, and if you put the work in your skill level will greatly improve. If you don't want to work or come to class, engineering may not be the major for you. Mr. Winsor has a great sense of humor but pay attention because you will learn a lot. My favorite professor!
Winsor is the funniest professor that I have ever had. He is also knowledgable about what he teaches. I would highly recommend.

Brad, throughout almost EVERY class will rant about doing some form of drugs, trying to be funny, but when you try to ask questions on course content, he will reply rudley and sarcastically like it is all a joke to him. He did not even release ANY grades until 1 wk b4 the final and the project were due. I learned everything from youtube not Brad.
Talks the entire class and does not help during class. Very easy to get off topic. He is not clear with instructions.

Mr. Winsor is a excellent teacher! He makes class fun and truly cares about his students. If you don't want to work, this is not the class for you. I'd never done any engineering graphics so I pretty much lived in his office hours. He was very helpful and a great person. Finish assignments early and go to him for help. Best teacher I've ever had!
Assignments are not graded and returned in a timely manner. Grading is erratic. I would recommend that students avoid this professor.

This man is so annoying. You do the littlest thing wrong and he will almost give you a failing grade on the assignment. He is a terrible human being who thinks this class is preparing you for the real world. Most real world applications of solidworks wont punish you heavy if you make a small mistake. You literally just redo it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He chooses quantity over quality. While other edg classes are just learning the basics of solidworks, we are given 14 parts/drawings per assignments.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I have rated him before. I'll say good man bad at teaching. He showed me a heart of gold though. It was mathematically impossible to pass this class that I needed a C in for standing but not only did he pass me he gave me that C. He grades hard and doesn't explain which hurt me more and more over time. Don't take without prior cad experience.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests? Not many

comment: He is funny but there comes a time when a teacher needs to be serious and actually teach. Most classes are him ranting off task and briefly going over a part file. He will heavily mark a paper then slap a grade on it. Two people can make the exact same mistake and be graded differently.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He assigns a lot of homework, and isn't very forgiving of mistakes, but he knows what he is talking about, makes the class fun, and will give A's to the students that put forth a reasonable amount of effort.

When he's actually on-task, he can be pretty helpful in completing the assignments. However, this is hardly ever. He makes horrible jokes so often that it quickly becomes frustratingly pointless to ask him questions. Complete the assignments early and go to his office hours; he's very willing to help. Not the worst teacher but not my first choice.

When I tell you there is no clear grading skill. I got 2 points off for a line that was a mm off and then 10 points off for the same mistake. He does not make his grading clear so you have no idea where you stand in the class. However he does help you with your drawings if you ask him too. Overall you have to put in the work for a good grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He is hilarious and he is very helpful if you go to his office hours. That being said his hilariousness has a big downside. Almost all of his lectures are spent with him making jokes and avoiding answering questions. He also grades very difficult with a ton of projects and no real grading scale. I was very surprised when I saw that I got an A.

DO NOT TAKE. He had no grade scale. Very tough  grading... Haven't gotten back 2 assignments so don't know what I have in the class. Please take someone else. Doesn't know how to teach. Nice person, not a teacher.  DO NOT TAKE.

Would not recommend. Very very tough grader. Even after taking his class I have no idea what I was supposed to do. Even though subject is interesting, he makes it a pain in the ___. Lots and lots of assignments. Very easy to get confused.  He keeps saying " Drawing must look like the source drawing" but then says "we had to improve d source drawin"

He doesn't answer your question when asked. He isn't clear on anything. His notes are a proven lie as I followed them and still got the drawing wrong because "it's suppose to look exactly like the source drawing." Called him out on it and the class agreed but instead told me I needed to practice. His class isn't hard, he just makes it hard.

Very talkative and excited about his job. He actually cares about how you do. He gives several opportunities to score high in his class. He gives great feedback and answers every question thrown at him.
Easily the most interesting professor in the world.

Eccentric and  passionate about his class. I found his humor refreshing. He grades hard, but if you go to him for help he WILL guide you to the right answers (as long as you make a genuine effort).  Go to class!  He's also understanding if you talk to him.  I think students either love him or hate him.  I enjoyed his class.

Inconsistent, moody, makes bad jokes. Spends too much time in class trying to make jokes or talking about irrelevant things, then rushes through the actual CAD modeling that would be useful to learn how to do. Goes off on rants about random things. One of the worst professors I've had. Take a different professor.

Grades insanely hard on hand drawn assignments and gives little to NO FEEDBACK whatsoever on why you received the grade you did. May or may not be on meth. If possible, do not take him. Conrey or Como either one would be a much better choice. Subject matter is interesting, but he gives very little instruction on how to complete some assignments.

Professor Winsor is not a "normal" professor. Eccentric, entertaining, witty, .... characteristics that fit him. You will never be more entertained in a lecture.  Even though you may laugh, pay attention. Take advantage of office hours to get help with assignments. Go to class or you will fail. Lots of work, but worth it.
